summary: This document is a chain of emails from 2019-2021 between federal prosecutors in the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and the District of New Mexico (DNM) regarding coordination on the Jeffrey Epstein case. The emails discuss scheduling calls, sharing information about New Mexico-specific investigations, victim interviews, property seizure/forfeiture, and media inquiries related to Epstein's New Mexico property (Zorro Ranch).

persons.name: John Anderson
persons.role: US Attorney for the District of New Mexico
persons.context: Mentioned as the US Attorney who has asked the DNM prosecutor to track the impact of Ghislaine Maxwell's indictment on the seizure/forfeiture of Epstein's New Mexico property.

persons.name: Brandon Fyffe
persons.context: Addressed in emails, involved in scheduling calls and discussing New Mexico-related Epstein matters.

persons.name: Holland S. Kastrin
persons.context: Initiates a request for a call about NM-related Epstein matters and is copied on follow-up emails.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Mentioned as a colleague on the SDNY Epstein case who could be available for a call when the primary prosecutor is in trial.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Mentioned as a colleague on the SDNY Epstein case who could be available for a call when the primary prosecutor is in trial.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the investigation; discussions concern his New Mexico property, victim interviews, and state/federal investigations into crimes there.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referenced regarding a new indictment against her, with conduct in New Mexico forming the basis of an overt act.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Referenced in a news article link about an alleged victim (Jane Doe 15) who mentioned him as a 'good friend' of Epstein.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Named in the URL of a news article about Jane Doe 15's allegations.

persons.name: Jane Doe 15
persons.context: An alleged victim who accused Epstein of rape and referenced Bill Clinton; her case is the subject of media reporting discussed by prosecutors.

persons.name: Hector Balderas
persons.context: Quoted in a news article as saying his office is conducting a state-level criminal investigation into Epstein's Zorro Ranch 'in coordination with' the SDNY.

persons.name: Stephanie Garcia Richard
persons.context: Took action to revoke grazing leases held by Epstein's company (Cypress Inc.) on state trust land and notified the AG of potential criminal activity.

persons.name: Jonathon
persons.role: Prosecutor, Fraud and Public Corruption Section
persons.context: Email signature indicates the sender is from the Fraud and Public Corruption Section.

connections.description: Maxwell's indictment includes overt acts based on conduct in New Mexico related to Epstein's case.
Referenced in a news article where an alleged victim describes Clinton as a 'good friend' of Epstein.
Balderas states his state investigation is being conducted 'in coordination with' the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY.
Garcia Richard's office notified Balderas's office about potential criminal activity on Epstein's leased state land.
Multiple emails show scheduling calls and sharing information to coordinate on Epstein-related matters in New Mexico.

events.title: New Indictment Against Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The SDNY secured a new indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell, with conduct in New Mexico forming the basis of one of the overt acts.

events.title: Media Report on Jane Doe 15
events.description: CBS Los Angeles publishes an article where 'Jane Doe 15' alleges Jeffrey Epstein raped her as a teen and referenced Bill Clinton as a 'good friend' of Epstein.

events.title: New Mexico Revokes Epstein Leases
events.description: New Mexico State Land Commissioner Stephanie Garcia Richard revokes grazing leases held by Epstein's company, Cypress Inc., on state trust land.

events.title: Coordination with New Mexico AG
events.description: The DNM U.S. Attorney's office speaks with the New Mexico AG's office, which agrees to cease its own sex trafficking investigation and share information with the federal office.

locations: New York, NY 10007 (SDNY office at 1 St. Andrew's Plaza)
keyFacts: Federal prosecutors from New York and New Mexico were actively coordinating on aspects of the Epstein investigation related to his New Mexico property and activities.

The New Mexico Attorney General's office had agreed to defer its sex trafficking investigation to federal authorities but was conducting a separate state criminal investigation 'in coordination with' the SDNY.
State authorities in New Mexico took independent action by revoking Epstein's company's grazing leases on state trust land.
Prosecutors discussed submitting New Mexico-specific questions for victim interviews and potential search warrant applications related to the Zorro Ranch property.
Media reporting about an alleged victim (Jane Doe 15) mentioning Bill Clinton was circulated among the prosecutors.
